009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Collection;
013import java.util.Deque;
014import java.util.LinkedList;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.PriorityQueue;
017
018import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
019import imagingbook.common.util.bits.BitMap;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This class implements the "linear-time" ("local flooding")
024 * component tree algorithm described in [1].
025 * See Section 26.2.3 of [2] for a detailed description (Algs. 26.3 - 26.4).
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] D. Nister and H. Stewenius, "Linear Time Maximally Stable Extremal Regions", 
029 * Computer Vision - ECCV 2008. pp. 183-196, Springer Berlin/Heidelberg (2008).
030 * <br>
031 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2022/11/19
036 *
037 * @param <T> the type of properties to be attached to components
038 */
039public class ComponentTreeLinearTime<T> extends ComponentTree<T> {
040        
041        private final List<Component<T>> components;
042        private final Component<T> root;
043        
044        /**
045         * Constructor. 
046         * Creates a new component tree from a {@link PixelMap} representing
047         * a gray-level image.
048         * @param P a {@link PixelMap}
049         */
050        public ComponentTreeLinearTime(PixelMap P) {
051                components = new ArrayList<Component<T>>();
052                root = buildTree(P);
053        }
054        
055        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
056        
057        @Override
058        public Component<T> getRoot() {
059//              return components.get(components.size() - 1);   // root is the last component
060                return root;
061        }
062
063        @Override
064        public Collection<Component<T>> getComponents() {
065                return components;
066        }
067        
068        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
069
070        /**
071         * Creates the component set from a {@link PixelMap}.
072         * Modifies {@link #components}.
073         * The last item in {@link #components} is the root component.
074         * @param P the input image
075         */
076        private Component<T> buildTree(PixelMap P) {            
077                final BitMap V = new BitMap(P.width, P.height);         // "visited", all set to false by default
078                final PriorityQueue<Pixel> B = new PriorityQueue<>();   // heap of boundary points that is sorted by 'val'
079                final Deque<Component<T>> C = new LinkedList<>();               // stack of region components
080                
081                Pixel p = P.getPixel(0, 0);                             // start point (seed), could be any pixel
082                V.set(p); //p.setVisited();                                     // p is the current point, mark as accessible
083                C.push(makeComponent(p.val));                           // push an empty component onto stack
084                
085                while (p != null) {                                                     // repeat until all pixels are done
086                        Pixel n = p.getNextNeighbor();                  // get the next neighbor of p (pixels keep track of visited neighbors)
087                        while (n != null) {
088                                if (!V.get(n)) {                                        // (!n.isVisited())
089                                        V.set(n);                                               //n.setVisited();
090                                        if (n.val >= p.val) {           
091                                                B.add(n);                                       // add neighbor to the boundary heap
092                                        }
093                                        else {
094                                                B.add(p);                                                       // move current pixel back to boundary heap 
095                                                C.push(makeComponent(n.val));   // create an empty component for the neighbor pixel
096                                                p = n;                                                          // make neighbor the current pixel
097                                        }
098                                }
099                                n = p.getNextNeighbor();
100                        }
101                        
102                        C.peek().addPoint(p);                                   // add the current pixel to the top-of-stack component
103                        
104                        Pixel q = B.poll();                                             // remove the first point from the heap of boundary pixels
105                        if (q != null && q.val > p.val) {               // new pixel value (q) is greater than current value (p)
106                                processStack(q.val, C);                         // see below
107                        }
108                        p = q;                                                                  // update the current pixel
109                }
110                
111                if (C.size() != 1) {    // just to make sure!
112                        throw new RuntimeException("component stack size must be 1 but is " + C.size());
113                }
114                Component<T> r = C.peek();                                      // the root component is still on the stack
115                processStack(Integer.MAX_VALUE, C);             // process the root component
116                
117                return r;
118        }
119        
120
121        
122        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
123
124        /**
125         * This method is called whenever the current pixel value is raised.
126         * Processes the top items on the component stack.
127         * Modifies {@link #components}.
128         * @param v     new "target" level
129         * @param C component stack
130         */
131        private void processStack(int v, Deque<Component<T>> C) {
132                while (!C.isEmpty() && v > C.peek().getLevel()) {               
133                        Component<T> c1 = C.poll();     // retrieve the top-of-stack component
134                        components.add(c1);                             // "emit" component c1 (note: c1.parent == null)
135
136                        if (v < Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
137                                Component<T> c2 = (C.isEmpty() || v < C.peek().getLevel()) ?
138                                                makeComponent(v) :              // c2 = artificial component with level v
139                                                C.pop();                                // c2 = next component on the stack 
140                                
141                                // merge c1 into c2 (c2 becomes parent of c1)
142                                c2.addChild(c1);
143                                c2.addToSize(c1.getSize());
144                                c1.setParent(c2);
145                                C.push(c2);     // insert c2 into the stack C (again)
146                        }
147                }
148        }
149        
150        
151        private int nextComponentIndex = 0;
152        
153        private Component<T> makeComponent(int level) {
154                return new Component<>(level, nextComponentIndex++);
155        }
156
157}
